definition: lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
net/network
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to fight to one's last gasp
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
lit. to strike a stone with egg (idiom); to attempt the impossible/to invite disaster by overreaching oneself
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to brave it out/to the bitter end
